reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

description.narrative: The education sector is the main sector of the Finland's Country Strategy 2016-2019. The Finnish funding to Mozambique's education sector is channeled through the common fund FASE which supports the education strategy ESSP III (Education Sector Support Pro gramme III) 2012-2016 extended until the end of the year 2019.The years 2018-2019 cover child education basic education secondary education adult education and institutional development including teacher education. 76 % of funding is for basic education.Th e Education Sector Programme's objectives are to guarantee a comprehensive 7-year basic education improve the capacity of the Ministry of Education to implement the national educational programme decrease adult illiteracy especially that of women and incre ase secondary education. Finland's objectives in FASE are according to the Country Strategy: (i) more students can have education in their mother tongue (ii) equality in education materialize (iii) education is more high-quality taking into account especia l need children and (iv) develop educational administration. The evaluation of the Finnish Country Strategy (2012-2015) states that the Finnish support to the Mozambique's educational sector has been productive. Girls' attendance to school has increased si zes of school classes and regional disparity have decreased. According to the recommendations of the evaluation the educational sector should also be determined to be the main result area of the bilateral support.Finland's good status in the educational se ctor will also be utilized in export promotion. Child education projects are under preparation through the Finnpartnership matchmaking and the possible visit of the minister of education will be utilized in the educational export.The common fund FASE has n ine donors and Finland is the fourth biggest. Finland's share in funding is 10 per cent. The budget of FASE for the years 2018-2019 is 1917 million USD.
